alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Apache and Navajo Counties, near the Vernon area. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Vernon Creek, Sepulveda Creek, Pulcifer Creek, Rocky Arroyo, Mineral Creek, Brown Creek and Silver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon, Land of the Pioneers Trailhead and Little Ortega Lake. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 349 and 364. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 365. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
